intro: Parinari albida, commonly known as white parinari, is a small to medium-sized deciduous tree native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its smooth, pale bark and simple, alternate leaves. The tree produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are followed by round, fleshy fruits containing a single seed. Its botanical features make it adaptable to various soil types, though it prefers well-drained conditions. The plant is also valued for its ornamental appeal and has some traditional uses in local medicine.
